newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Cap Volmac sees healthy growth 1996.
newsitem.headline: Cap Volmac sees healthy growth 1996.

text.p: Software and computer services firm Cap Volmac Group NV said on Tuesday it expected a healthy growth for the whole of 1996, but added it did not expect the strong increase of the first six months of 1996 to be continued in the whole-year.
"The growth in the first six months is not expected to continue in 1996 as a whole due to a relative strong growth in the second half of 1995," the firm said in a statement.
First-half 1996 profit was 41.1 million guilders versus 33.8 million in the same period of 1995.

Last March the company, which is 58 percent owned by France's Cap Gemini, said it could not give a 1996 forecast but added it saw scope for further growth. In 1995 the year net profit rose by nine percent to 72 million guilders.
